#Text=The Cleveland Cavaliers ( 32 - 21 ) defeated the Los Angeles Lakers ( 13 - 38 ) 120 - 105 on Sunday at Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland .
#Text=In a dominating effort , the Cavaliers got out to a quick start in this matchup , out - scoring the Lakers 64 - 49 in the first half alone .

#Text=The Cavaliers were the superior shooters in this game as well , going 55 percent from the field and 55 percent from the three - point line , while the Lakers went just 41 percent from the floor and 30 percent from beyond the arc .
#Text=The Cavaliers ' big three of LeBron James , Kevin Love and Kyrie Irving did most of the damage in this one .
#Text=Love led all scorers , finishing with 32 points ( 11 - 18 FG , 7 - 8 3Pt , 3 - 5 FT ) , 10 rebounds and three assists .
#Text=After a dissapointing performance in Friday 's game against the Pacers , where he finished with just five points , it was good to see him get things turned back around and play well .
#Text=Also having an impressive showing , Irving recorded 28 points ( 10 - 14 FG , 5 - 8 3Pt , 3 - 4 FT ) , four rebounds and ten assists .
#Text=It marked his fifth double - double of the season .
#Text=Over his last two games , he 's now combined for 57 points , eight rebounds and 15 assists , as he 's been dominating his competition .
#Text=James on the other hand , totaled 22 points ( 8 - 16 FG , 2 - 7 3Pt , 4 - 5 FT ) , 10 rebounds and eight assists , nearly recording a triple - double Sunday .
#Text=He did n't have to do as much work as usual , considering the success of both Love and Irving .
#Text=For the Lakers , rookie point guard Jordan Clarkson had a solid perfomance , finishing with 20 points ( 6 - 14 FG , 0 - 2 3Pt , 8 - 9 FT ) , six rebounds and four assists .
#Text=It was a season - high in points for the rookie , who has now scored 14 points or more in five out his last six games , despite averaging only 7 per game on the season .
#Text=He 's been getting more and more comfortable in the starting lineup , and its beginning to show with more consistent play .
#Text=Without much production from the rest of the starters , the Lakers bench had to put up some numbers .
#Text=Ed Davis went 6 - for - 7 from the floor and 4 - for - 4 from the free throw line to finish with 16 points and nine rebounds in just 24 minutes .
#Text=He 's averaging only 8 points per game so far this season , so it was a nice surprise for the Lakers .
#Text=Also coming off the bench , Wesley Johnson played well .
#Text=In 29 minutes , he finished with 15 points ( 5 - 14 FG , 2 - 4 3Pt , 3 - 3 FT ) , two assists and two steals .
#Text=The two steals matched a season - high .
#Text=The Cavaliers ' next game will be at home against the Miami Heat on Wednesday , while the Lakers will be at home against the Denver Nuggets on Tuesday .
